headline: Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) Beats Q2 Sales Targets But Stock Drops
summary: Fashion brand Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 13.7% year on year to $1.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.77 per share was 7.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Ralph Lauren Flags Weak Macro Visibility, Maintains Cautious Outlook
summary: Ralph Lauren Corp. (NYSE:RL) stock plunged on Thursday even as the company reported stronger-than-expected results for the first quarter of fiscal 2026, driven by broad-based demand and margin expansion across geographies. Revenue rose 14% year over year to $1.72 billion, exceeding the analyst consensus estimate of $1.64 billion. Adjusted earnings were $3.77 per diluted share, beating expectations of $3.43. headline: Ralph Lauren lifts annual revenue view on demand from affluent shoppers
summary: (Reuters) -Ralph Lauren raised its annual revenue forecast on Thursday, signaling robust demand from affluent shoppers for its Polo shirts and cable-knit sweaters in North America, Europe and China.  Ralph, which sells its popular Polo Bear sweater for up to $398 on its website, has relied on its loyal, high-income customers to fuel sales and profit growth.  CEO Patrice Louvet said the company remains cautious about the global operating environment in the back half of the fiscal year.

Ralph, which sells its popular Polo Bear sweater for up to $398 on its website, has relied on its loyal, high-income customers to fuel sales and profit growth.  CEO Patrice Louvet said the company remains cautious about the global operating environment in the back half of the fiscal year.
